717465f-b.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 41st Street
717465f-b.text:
(1)
The Broadway Theatre, Broadway at the S.W. corner of 41st Street.
his theatre will be rased in about a year and the 33-story Bricken-
Textile Building built on its site.
January 29, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
A closer view of the Broadway Theatre.
January 29, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
Clearing on the site of the Broadway Theatre where the Bricken-
Textile Building will be erected. Aoross the clearing may be seen
the N.W. corner of Seventh Avenue and 4lst Street.
March 10, 1929.
L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

717466f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 41st Street
717466f-a.text:
(1)
Broadway, east side, at 41st Street, showing, on the right, the
Hotel Continental, which will be demolished within a year and re-
placed by the 43-story Continental Building, and on the left the
Calvert Building, which will stand in 1936, seen from across the
wreckage of the Broadway Theatre.
March 11, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
Another view of the same.
March 11, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

717466f-b.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 41st Street
717466f-b.text:
(1)
Broadway, east side, at 41st Street, showing, on the right, the
Hotel Continental, which will be demolished within a year and re-
placed by the 43-story Continental Building, and on the left the
Calvert Building, which will stand in 1936, seen from across the
wreckage of the Broadway Theatre.
March 11, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
Another view of the same.
March 11, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

717468f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 41st Street
717468f-a.text:
The Hotel Continental, Broadway, at and adjoining the S.E.
of 4lst Street. The hotel and the three-story building which :
it are shortly to be demolished for the erection of the 43-sto
Continental Building.
About 1929.
Edwin Levick.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

717474f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 41st Street
717474f-a.text:
Broadway, east side, from 41st to 43rd Streets. At the extreme
right is the Hotel Aberdeen, later the Hotel Calvert, and later
still the Calvert Building. In the centre is the Hotel Knickerbocker,
aoon to be converted into an office building. At the extreme left
is the Hotel Wallick, later the Hotel Cadillac, and the Hotel Rector,
later the Hotel Claridge.
About 1915.
Gift of E. M. Jenks.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

723525f.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 41st Street
723525f.text:
Broadway (diagonally from the lower left to tbe upner right),
north from W. 41st to 48th Street as viewed westward from the air
to show the Times Square area. Prominently shown are the Times
ard the Paramount Buuildinogs and the Hotel Astor. lIn the foreground
apnears the tower atop the Bush Terminal Bldg. on 42nd Street.
About 1930
Ewing Galloway
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
Neg.~ 2S9

717467f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 41st Street
717467f-a.text:
(1)
The Hotel Continental, Broadway at the S.E. corner of 41st
Street, two years before its demolition.
May 5, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, as seen across wreckage of the Broadway Theatre and from
570 Seventh Ave.
February 4, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
Neo. 21G

717463f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 41st Street
717463f-a.text:
1437-1439 Broadway, adjoining the S.W. corner of 41st Street,
showing at the extreme right a portion of the clearing for the
Bricken-Textile Building, which will occupy the south side of
41st Street from Broadway to Seventh Avenue.
March 10, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

717470f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 41st Street
717470f-a.text:
The Calvert Building, Broadway at the N.E. corner of 41st Street.
At the right is the Continental Building, on the site of the old
Hotel Continental.
March 18, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

717469f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 41st Street
717469f-a.text:
Broadway, west side, from 42nd to 41st Streets. At the extreme
left is the St. Cloud Hotel. The Rossmore Hotel is in the centre.
About 1885.
Brown Brothers.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

712737f-a.title: Manhattan: 41st Street - Broadway
712737f-a.text:
(1)
41st Street, north side, west from, but not including,Broadway.
The clearing in the foreground was left by the demolition
of the Broadway Theatre. On the S. W. corner of Seventh
Avenue stands the Cowan Building, built around 1924.
March 18,1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, including Broadway, and showing the new Bricken-
Textile building on the site of the Broadway Theatre; it
almost completely hides the Cowan Building.
About 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

717465f-c.text:

his theatre will be rased in about a year and the 33-story Bricken-

L. Sperr.

712735f-a.title: Manhattan: 41st Street - Broadway
712735f-a.text:
41st Street, north side, east from but not including Broadway, to
and including Sixth Avo.
About 1920.
Brown Brothers.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

712736f-a.title: Manhattan: 41st Street - Broadway
712736f-a.text:
41st Street, north side, at and adjoining the N.E. corner of
Broadway, showing the Calvert Building, (formerly Calvert
Hotel),on the corner, and the back door of the Bush Terminal
Building at No. 139. No. 141 is a new 5 story building erect-
ed on the site of ''Diamond Jim'' Brady's old residence. The
clearing in the right foreground is the site of the Broadway
Theatre.
May 22, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
